Body: Baker made 7 cakes and 148 pastries. If he sold 15 cakes and 103 pastries
Question: How many pastries would baker still have?

Body: Robin cut off 13 inches of his hair. If his hair was 14 inches long initially
Question: How long is his hair now?

Body: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 2 sets of tables, each having the same number of chairs. If there are a total of 12 chairs in the backyard
Question: How many chairs are there for each table?

Body: Debby bought 88 water bottles and 13 soda bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 4 water bottles and 87 soda bottles a day
Question: How many days would the water bottles last?

Body: Last week Fred had 60 dollars and Jason had 19 dollars. Jason washed cars over the weekend and now has 33 dollars.
Question: How much money did Jason make washing cars?

Body: Paul sold some books in a garage sale leaving him with 27 books. If he had 136 books initially
Question: How many books did he sell?

Body: Next on his checklist is wax to stick the feathers together. If the feathers require 166 g of wax and right now he has 20 g
Question: How many more grams of wax does he need?

Body: The bananas in Philip's collection are organized into 196 groups. If there are a total of 392 bananas in Philip's banana collection
Question: How big is each group?

Body: The grasshopper and the frog had a jumping contest. The grasshopper jumped 9 inches and the frog jumped 12 inches.
Question: How much farther did the frog jump than the grasshopper?

Body: In Haley's class 13 boys love to play marbles and 50 boys love to play cards. If Haley has 26 marbles
Question: How many will each of the boys receive?
